sentence.Network_en: There wasn't even a convenient place for students to assemble between classes.
sentence.Network_cn: 在课间，学生们连一个方便凑在一起的地方都没有。

sentence.Network_en: "What time were you planning lunch?"—"Half past twelve, if that's convenient."
sentence.Network_cn: “你打算什么时候吃午饭？”“如果方便的话，12点半。”

sentence.Network_en: We cannot make this minority a convenient excuse to turn our backs.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们不能拿少数这几个人作为一种方便的借口而对此置之不理。

1、便利抽样（convenience sampling） 又称为偶遇抽样、任意抽样，是指研究者根据现实情况，以自己方便的形式抽取到偶然遇到  …
便利商店（Convenience Store）在东亚常用的简称，尤其在销售业上常用。（此简称仅在东亚流行）CVS药局（CVS/pharmacy）是 …
...nal grocery store）：是以香烟、酒、饮料休闲食品为主，独立、传统的无明显品牌形象的。, 2、便利店（convenience store）：满足顾客便利性需求为主要目的。, 3、（discount store）：是店铺装修简单，提供有限服务，商品价格低廉的一种小型超市业态。.

means.word_mean: 附近的;方便的;实用主义的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'befitting, becoming, suitable'): from Latin convenient- 'assembling, agreeing, fitting', from the verb convenire (see convene)

entry.def: If a way of doing something is convenient, it is easy, or very useful or suitable for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...a flexible and convenient way of paying for business expenses...
example.tran: 灵活而方便的业务费用支付方式

example.ex: The family thought it was more convenient to eat in the kitchen.
example.tran: 这家人认为在厨房吃饭更方便。

entry.tran: 附近的;方便到达的;近便的
entry.def: If you describe a place as convenient, you are pleased because it is near to where you are, or because you can reach another place from there quickly and easily.

example.ex: The town is well placed for easy access to London and convenient for Heathrow Airport...
example.tran: 这座城市地理位置优越，到伦敦和希思罗机场都很方便。

example.ex: Martin drove along until he found a convenient parking place.
example.tran: 马丁一直往前开，直到找到了一个方便的停车场。

entry.def: A convenient time to do something, for example to meet someone, is a time when you are free to do it or would like to do it.

example.ex: She will try to arrange a mutually convenient time and place for an interview...
example.tran: 她会尽力安排一个双方都方便的时间和地点进行面试。

example.ex: Would this evening be convenient for you?

entry.tran: (态度、行为等)方便的，省力的，省事的
entry.def: If you describe someone's attitudes or actions as convenient, you think they are only adopting those attitudes or performing those actions in order to avoid something difficult or unpleasant.

example.ex: We cannot make this minority a convenient excuse to turn our backs...
example.tran: 我们不能拿少数这几个人作为一种方便的借口而对此置之不理。

means.word_mean: 1. suited to your comfort or purpose or needs;

sentences.sentence: "found a handy spot for the can opener"

means.word_mean: 3. large and roomy (`convenient' is archaic in this sense);

Sentence.sentence: Nursing homes are well-equipped and convenient.
It is cheaper than calling long distance, and a lot more convenient than waiting until Sunday for the telephone rates to drop.
It's all very handy stuff, I guess, a convenient way to be a do-it-yourself without being all that good with tools.
Campuses willing to adopt convenient schedules along with more focused, less-expensive degrees may find that they have a competitive advantage in attracting bright, motivated students.
Convenient academic schedules with more-focused, less-expensive degrees will be more attractive to bright, motivated students

means.word_mean: 方便的, 便利的, 合适的

sentences.en: I have to find a convenient location for the shelves.
sentences.cn: 我得找一合适的地方放这些书架。

sentences.en: May I come and talk with you whenever it's convenient?
sentences.cn: 在你方便时我能来和你谈谈吗?

sentences.en: Is it convenient for you to go out tonight?
It is useful to have a convenient supermarket.

jushi.english: The post office is at a convenient distance from our school.
A good toolbox is a convenient thing to have in the house.
jushi.chinese: 家里预备了一个好的工具箱就方便多了。

jushi.english: This is a convenient tool for hair-cutting.
jushi.chinese: 这是一种极便利的理发工具。
